intro: Tritonia pottsii, commonly known as the Potts' bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tritonia pottsii is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its flowers bloom in late summer, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural habitats.
